meanings.definition: To restore pressure to (a system or container)
meanings.sent1: After fixing the leak, we need to repressurize the tire.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will repressurize the air conditioning system.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally let all the air out of the balloon, so I had to repressurize it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a deflated balloon, needing someone to repressurize her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The scuba diver had to quickly repressurize his suit to avoid decompression sickness.

meanings.definition: To increase the pressure within (a system or container)
meanings.sent1: To cook faster, you can repressurize the pressure cooker.
meanings.sent2: The engineer decided to repressurize the hydraulic system for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The soda can was so flat that I had to repressurize it by shaking it.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to repressurize the room, making everyone more energetic.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds seemed to repressurize the atmosphere, signaling an impending downpour.
